content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Louisiana Recovery Authority</origin> <pubdate>20070501</pubdate> <title>Louisiana Speaks Regional Vision Transit Corridors, UTM Zone 15N NAD 83, Louisiana Recovery Authority (2007), [louisiana_speaks_vision_transit_corridors]</title> <geoform>vector digital data</geoform> <onlink>http://lagic.lsu.edu/data/lra/louisiana_speaks_vision_transit_corridors.zip</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract> This GIS shapefile data illustrates the primary and secondary transit corridors included in the Louisiana Speaks Regional Plan Vision. This network accommodates a land use pattern that focuses new growth along fixed transit corridors, links urban, city, and town centers, provides evacuation alternatives, and acts as a first line of defense against future storms. The network represents a balanced transportation network with investment in both roadways and transit.  The routes are based on data from the Louisiana State Department of Transportation and Development (DOTD) Statewide Transportation Plan, projects from local Metropolitan Planning Organization Master Transportation Plans (MTP), the Louisiana Coastal Protection and Restoration Authority (CPRA) Master Plan, and input from Louisiana Speaks Regional Plan workshops.  The Louisiana Speaks Regional Plan process study area includes the 35 southernmost parishes of Louisiana. </abstract> <purpose> The Louisiana Speaks Regional Plan Vision illustrates a future for South Louisiana based on the input of tens of thousands of citizens and stakeholders. It also includes elements of the Coastal Protection and Restoration Authority\ufffd\ufffds Master Plan, the Louisiana State Department of Transportation and Development (DOTD), and other state and regional agency plans.  The vision builds on a sustainable recovery that restores coastal wetlands, constructs strategic levees, and reinvests in historic communities. New growth is focused in and around existing communities, and linked to investments in protection infrastructure, regional transportation, and economic zones. </purpose> <supplinf>None.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>20070501</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>publication date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-94.906024</westbc> <eastbc>-89.085500</eastbc> <northbc>30.660376</northbc> <southbc>29.890219</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>none</themekt> <themekey>Louisiana Speaks</themekey> <themekey>Regional Plan</themekey> <themekey>Vision</themekey> <themekey>Transit Corridor</themekey> <themekey>Transit Route</themekey> <themekey>Transit</themekey> <themekey>Primary</themekey> <themekey>Secondary</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>none</placekt> <placekey>Louisiana</placekey> <placekey>LA</placekey> <placekey>South Louisiana</placekey> <placekey>Louisiana Coast</placekey> <placekey>Gulf Coast</placekey> </place> <temporal> <tempkey>Post-Katrina</tempkey> <tempkey>Post-Rita</tempkey> <tempkey>2050</tempkey> </temporal> </keywords> <accconst>None.</accconst> <useconst> Acknowledgement of the Louisiana Speaks Regional Plan and Louisiana Recovery Authority would be appreciated in products developed from these data.
